content: For CDA, don't need Chief Complaint. This may be placed in reason for referral, patient history, or HPI.

Zabrina Gonzaga said:

For CDA, don't need Chief Complaint. This may be placed in reason for referral, patient history, or HPI.

To clarify, this would apply to both FHIR and CDA - the patient's original chief complaint, if relevant to referral, would be conveyed as part of the Reason for Referral or the Medical History (History of Present Illness Section in CDA), and does not need to be conveyed on its own.
